vjsjolly wrote:
> hi,
> 
> I am using heritrix-1.10.1 on windows xp. I create a .bat file to run
> heritrix1.10.1. Now i extracted the profile folder from
> heritrix-1.10.1.jar and placed it in %HERITRIX_HOME%\conf.
> 
> Now as per he manual, i set the user-agent and from as
> 
> <map name="http-headers">
>       <string name="user-agent">Mozilla/5.0 (compatible;
> heritrix/@VERSION@ +http://www.apache.org)</string>
>       <string name="from">myinbox@...</string>
>     </map>
> 
> and put http://www.apache.org as seed in seeds.txt
> 
> then i submit the job in WUI and started it, it shows me running job,
> after 15 mins job finished but there is no arcs files, and also it
> shows me failed to crawl seed -6. am not getting what could be the
> problem. any idea is helpful

-6 is specifically "Prerequisite domain-lookup failed, precluding fetch 
attempt". (See 
http://crawler.archive.org/articles/user_manual/glossary.html#statuscodes
among other places.)

You may have customized the crawl scope such that necessary prerequisite 
URLs may not be scheduled, or there may be something wrong with DNS 
resolution from your crawler machine.

Other issues regarding your user-agent:
  - the URL in the user-agent should  definitely include information 
describing the purpose of your crawl and contact information in case 
your crawl causes problems
  - you additionally may want to add to the generic heritrix software 
identifier to explain your crawl's origin/purpose, or at least add an 
approximate version number if you're working from CVS sources (only 
recommended for experts). Otherwise leave the version number that was in 
the default crawl profiles in the version you're using.

- Gordon @ IA
